text: Buttons (to edit) on rich text fields get pushed down if there are to much content in the columns. Is there a way to fix this so each of the sections are editable?
<@U25C65C3S> it is on my list to make some improvements there. i'll bump up the priority and try to get those worked out today or tomorrow.
one thing that you can do now that is a recent enhancement is resize the column
there is a resize handle that appears when close to the right edge of the column (unless it is the last column)
Ok I'll take a look. We've also been using inspect element to get the button too

Do you have a list of current fixes and proposed fixes? I'm not looking for timelines, but just looking at what is in the pipeline, and the priority. I also understand that they are possible to change.

<@U25PYL3Q8> since enhancements are subject to change, i don't have a list to share, but we will try to fix bugs as soon as we can (ideally measured in hours or days). if there are any particular missing features that are blocking you from being able to accomplish what you want, let <@U23602KDF> know.

<@U22PJPGK0> <@U22PU4G4A> We really need the ability to map & overwrite rows upon import. Creating a new database every time with manually creating multiple header rows is simply counterproductive and backwards. Thank you. Also the ability to change a rowâ€™s type would be nice, the HubL does not always do what is expected. We can give specific examples if need be. (i.e. text, image, rich text, url, etc)
<@U25C65C3S> the issue with cells in rich text columns has been fixed
we have map and overwrite in import on our TODO list. Your examples would be helpful relating to HubL not doing what's expected.
sounds good. we will send our example issues...
